children.title: Accounting
children.shortdesc: The Accounting modules in Vista include accounts payable, accounts receivable, cash management, and general ledger features.

children.title: Accounts Payable
children.shortdesc: A brief description of the Accounts Payable module.

children.title: Setup/Maintenance
children.shortdesc: Find information about setting up the Accounts Payable module to enable functionality, including company setup, 1099 types, payable categories and types, and the master record of all vendors.

children.title: Company Setup
children.shortdesc: Before you can begin processing in Accounts Payable, you must set up an Accounts Payable company for each company in which you will enter invoices, post payments, process 1099s, and perform other Accounts Payable processes.

children.title: Set up an AP Company
children.shortdesc: You must set up a minimum of one AP company in which you will maintain the control options necessary for Accounts Payable processing.

children.title: Checking for Unique AP Reference Numbers
Set up Master/Sub Vendor Level Validation
children.shortdesc: If you are using the master vendor/sub vendor feature, you can set up validation for AP reference numbers to ensure accurate control over which vendors are included.

children.title: Reporting Independent Contractors (United States)
children.shortdesc:
If your state requires businesses to report independent contractors, you can have the
      system automatically generate a report for all contractors meeting reporting requirements when
      posting payments in Accounts Payable.

children.title: About General Ledger and Subledger Posting Levels
children.shortdesc: Vista™ by Viewpoint allows you to define the level of detail that you want posted from Accounts Payable to the General Ledger accounts and to the subledgers of Job Cost, Equipment Management, Inventory, and Cash Management.

children.title: About Vendor Compliance for Non-PO/SL Invoices
children.shortdesc: With Vista, you have the ability to track compliance for invoices that are not associated with purchase orders and/or subcontracts.

children.title: Using Payable Categories
children.shortdesc: If you require separate GL accounting for the different divisions, branches, or regions within your company, you can set up pay categories to represent each division, with each pay category defining its own set of pay types for transaction posting.

children.title: Secure File Path
children.shortdesc: You can secure the data files created when generating and sending EFT information to financial institutions.

children.title: Payment Reporting Information
children.shortdesc: You can set up payment information to specify the reports used when printing checks and when generating electronic payments and credit service remittances.7/24/18: Changed this topic to a concept topic and converted all the tasks into separate topics.

children.title: Set Payment Reporting Information: United States
children.shortdesc: You can specify the reports used when printing checks and when generating electronic payments and credit service remittances.7/24/18: Created this as a separate topic from the Setting Payment Reporting Information topic. Added new steps (1&2) a little and added a short description and context information. Also modified the steps so they weren't passive.

children.title: Set Payment Reporting Information: Australia
children.shortdesc: You can specify the reports used when printing cheques and when generating electronic payments and payment service remittances.7/24/18: Added new steps (1&2) a little and added a short description and context information. Also modified the steps so they weren't passive, and made notes standard text.

children.title: Setting Payment Reporting Information: Canada
children.shortdesc:
You can specify the reports used when printing cheques and when generating electronic payments and payment service remittances.

      7/25/18: Added new steps (1&2) a little and added a short description and context information. Also modified the steps so they weren't passive, and made notes standard text

children.title: Attach Vendor Payment Reports to Payment History: United States
children.shortdesc: You can have the system automatically attach an electronic copy of payment information to payment history records when generating vendor payments in Accounts Payable.7/25/18: This task broken out from the Setting Payment Reporting Information topic. Also updated topic by adding short description and adding new steps (1&2). Also modified some of the content to be less passive.

children.title: Attach Vendor Payment Reports to Payment History: Australia
children.shortdesc: You can have the system automatically attach an electronic copy of payment information to payment history records when generating vendor payments in Accounts Payable.7/25/18: This topic was broken out from the Setting Payment Reporting Information: Australia topic. Also updated topic by adding short description and adding new steps (1&2). Also modified some of the content to be less passive.

children.title: Attach Vendor Payment Reports to Payment History: Canada
children.shortdesc: You can have the system automatically attach an electronic copy of payment information to payment history records when generating vendor payments in Accounts Payable.7/25/18: This topic was broken out from the Setting Payment Reporting Information: Canada topic. Also updated topic by adding short description and adding new steps (1&2). Also modified some of the content to be less passive.

children.title: About the AP Company Parameters Form
children.shortdesc: Use the AP Company Parameters form to set up and maintain the control options for Accounts Payable processing in each company. You must define these options before you begin processing in Accounts Payable.

children.title: Field Definitions: AP Company Parameters
children.shortdesc: The following is a list of field descriptions for the AP Company Parameters form. Many of the descriptions include links to other topics that provide additional information about or related to the topic.

children.title: Pay Categories
children.shortdesc: Find information about setting up pay categories for multi-divisional accounting. You only need to set up pay categories if you have selected to use pay categories in the AP Company Parameters form.

children.title: About the AP Pay Category Form
children.shortdesc: Use this form to set up and define pay categories.

children.title: Field Definitions: AP Pay Category Form
children.shortdesc: The following is a list of field descriptions for the AP Pay Category form.Many of the descriptions include links to other topics that provide additional information about or related to the topic.

children.title: Payable Types
children.shortdesc: Find information about payable types, including setting them up and associating them with the appropriate GL liability accounts and  pay categories.

children.title: About Payable Types
children.shortdesc:
Payable types determine  which liability payable accounts
 are credited (when invoices are posted) and debited (when they are paid).

children.title: About Using Pay Types for Check Selection
children.shortdesc: You can use Pay Types as a way of segregating payables you are preparing to pay.

children.title: About the AP Payable Types Form
children.shortdesc: Use the AP Payable Types form to set up payable types and assign them to each of your General Ledger payable liability accounts.

children.title: Field Definitions: AP Payable Types Form
children.shortdesc: The following is a list of field descriptions for the AP Payable Types form. Many of the descriptions include links to other topics that provide additional information about or related to the topic.

children.title: Restrict Pay Type to Pay Category
Purging Records
children.shortdesc: Find information about purging transaction detail records in Accounts Payable.

children.title: Purge Paid Transactions and Temporary Vendors
children.shortdesc: You can use the Paid Trans/Temp Vendors tab on the AP Purge form to remove paid transactions through a specified month/year.

children.title: Purge Monthly Vendor Totals
children.shortdesc: Use the Mthly Vendor Totals tab in the AP Purge form to remove vendor totals through a specified month/year.

children.title: Purge Payment History
children.shortdesc: Use the Payment History tab in the AP Purge form to delete payment History from the system.

children.title: Purge Annual 1099 Totals (U.S.)
children.shortdesc: You can purge 1099 totals for open and closed subledgers by year.

children.title: Purge Taxable Payments Records (Australia)
children.shortdesc: You can purge taxable payments data from the system by year.

children.title: Purge T5018 Totals (Canada)
children.shortdesc: You can purge T5018 data from the system by reporting period.

children.title: About the AP Purge Form
children.shortdesc: Use the AP Purge form to remove records that are no longer needed from the Accounts Payable database tables.

children.title: About the AP Batch Process Form
children.shortdesc: Use the AP Batch Process form to process (post) Accounts Payable batches.

children.title: Month
children.shortdesc: Enter the batch process month. This field defaults the current month.

children.title: Batch#
children.shortdesc:
Enter a valid batch number. Press F4 to look up the available batches if
      needed.

children.title: Invoices
children.shortdesc: Find information about invoicing in Accounts Payable, including AP invoices, recurring invoice, unapproved invoices, and on cost invoices (AU).

children.title: AP Invoices
children.shortdesc: Find information about entering invoices in Accounts Payable, including vendor invoices, as well as unapproved invoices that require approval before processing, and recurring invoices for expenses that occur on a regular basis.

children.title: About Accounts Payable Invoices
children.shortdesc: You can enter Accounts Payable invoices using the AP Transaction Entry form.

children.title: Enter Accounts Payable Invoices
children.shortdesc: Use the AP Transaction Entry form to enter accounts payable invoices.

children.title: Enter AP Invoice Lines: U.S.
children.shortdesc: Once you've created the header portion of an invoice, enter the detail line items. This article applies if you're working in an AP Company whose HQ Country is United States.

children.title: Enter AP Invoice Lines: Australia
children.shortdesc: Once you've created the header portion of an invoice, enter the detail line items. This article applies if you're working in an AP Company whose HQ Country is Australia.

children.title: Enter AP Invoice Lines: Canada
children.shortdesc: Once you've created the header portion of an invoice, enter the detail line items. This article applies if you're working in an AP Company whose HQ Country is Canada.

children.title: Add Purchase Orders to an AP Transaction Batch
children.shortdesc: You can add purchase orders to an AP transaction batch using the PO initialization feature.

children.title: Add Posted Transactions Back into a Batch
children.shortdesc: You can add previously posted transactions to a new or existing batch so that you can edit or delete them as needed, and then repost them.

children.title: About Assigning Line Types to AP Invoice Lines
children.shortdesc: You must assign a line type to each AP invoice line. The line type identifies where you want to post the expense, as well as the type of information required for that line type.

children.title: Copy Posted Transactions to an Open-Month Batch
children.shortdesc: You can copy transactions posted to the wrong month into a new batch so that you do not have to delete them in one batch and then manually re-enter them in another.

children.title: Move Unposted Transactions to an Open-Month Batch
children.shortdesc: You can move unposted transactions into a different batch month so that you do not have to delete them in one batch and manually re-enter them in another.

children.title: About Deleting Invoice Transactions
children.shortdesc: The method you should use to delete AP invoices/transactions depends where it is in the AP cycle.

children.title: Vendor Address Overrides for AP Invoices
Process AP Invoices
children.shortdesc: A high-level overview of processing accounts payable invoices/transaction from start to finish, with links to articles containing more detailed information.

children.title: Process Prepaid Invoices
children.shortdesc: Prepaid invoices are invoices that are paid using a manual check before the invoice paid by the check is even entered into the system.

children.title: Reprocess a Voided Prepaid Invoice
children.shortdesc: You can reprocess a previously voided prepaid invoice.

children.title: About the AP Transaction Entry Form
children.shortdesc: Use the AP Transaction Entry form to enter payable invoices or edit existing invoices, regardless of the form that was used to create the invoice.

children.title: Field Definitions: AP Transaction Entry Form
children.shortdesc: The following is a list of field descriptions for the AP Transaction Entry form.Many of the descriptions include links to other topics that provide additional information about or related to the topic.

EFT Child Support Payment Info: DL Code
Pay Type
children.shortdesc: The Pay Type field in AP Transaction Entry, Lines section, Info tab.

children.title: About Changing Posted Invoices
children.shortdesc: You can change invoice details using AP Transaction Entry, but the changes you can make depends on whether the invoice has been paid or not.

children.title: Processing VAT Invoices
children.shortdesc: Processing AP invoices with Value Added Tax (VAT) requires a slightly different process than other invoices, as VAT tax is not directly expensed.

children.title: About GL Posting Information for AP Invoices
children.shortdesc:
Every invoice posted in Accounts Payable (via the AP Transaction Entry form) updates the
        General Ledger based on the GL accounts defined for other modules throughout the
        system.

children.title: Intercompany Transactions
children.shortdesc: You can use a single AP company to process payables for more than one subledger company.

children.title: Clear Payable Transactions
children.shortdesc: Use the AP Clear Transactions form to clear transactions when it's been decided that payment will not be issued or that transactions were entered in error.

children.title: About the AP Add Transaction to Batch Form
children.shortdesc: Use the AP Add Transaction to Batch form to add previously posted transactions to a new or existing open batch. Access this form by selecting  File Add Transaction  from within the AP Transaction Entry form.

children.title: Field Definitions: AP Add Trans to Batch Form
children.shortdesc: The following is a list of field descriptions for the AP Add Trans to Batch   form. Many of the descriptions include links to other topics that provide additional information about or related to the topic.

children.shortdesc: The Source Batch # field on the AP Add Transaction to Batch form.

children.title: AP Transaction #
children.shortdesc: The AP Transaction # field on the AP Add Transaction to Batch form.

children.title: Vendor
children.shortdesc: The Vendor field on the AP Add Transaction to Batch form.

children.title: Pay Control
children.shortdesc: The Pay Control field in the AP Add Transaction to Batch form.

children.title: Pay Category
children.shortdesc: The Pay Category field in the AP Add Transaction to Batch form.

children.title: Invoice Dates
children.shortdesc: The Begin Invoice Date and End Invoice Date fields in the AP Add Transaction to Batch form.

children.title: Mark Added Transactions as "Delete"
children.shortdesc: The Mark Added Transaction as "Delete" check box in the AP Add Transaction to Batch form.

children.title: About the AP Purchase Order Initialize Form
children.shortdesc: Use the AP Purchase Order Initialize form to add purchase orders to an AP invoice transaction. Access this form from either the AP Transaction Entry or AP Unapproved Invoice Entry form by placing focus on the line item level and selecting  File Initialize from PO .

children.title: Field Definitions: AP Purchase Order Initialize Form
children.shortdesc: The following is a list of field descriptions for the AP Purchase Order Initialize form. Many of the descriptions include links to other topics that provide additional information about or related to the topic.

children.title: About the AP Copy Batch Month Selection Form
children.shortdesc: Use the AP Copy Batch Month Selection form to move or copy transactions from one batch to a new batch.

children.title: Field Definitions: AP Copy Batch Month Selection Form
children.shortdesc: The following is a list of field descriptions for the AP Copy Batch  form. Many of the descriptions include links to other topics that provide additional information about or related to the topic.

children.title: Batch Month
children.shortdesc: Batch Month field in the AP Copy Batch Month Selection form.

children.title: About the AP Clear Transactions Form
children.shortdesc: Use this form to clear a set of transactions when a payment will not be issued. The set consists of the original invoice and an reversing, or offsetting invoice.

children.title: Field Definitions: AP Clear Transactions Form
children.shortdesc: The following is a list of field descriptions for the AP Clear Transactions form. Many of the descriptions include links to other topics that provide additional information about or related to the topic.

children.title: Month
children.shortdesc: The Month field on the AP Clear Transactions form.

children.title: AP Transaction #
children.shortdesc: The AP Transaction # field on the AP Clear Transactions form.

children.title: Recurring Invoices
children.shortdesc: Find information about recurring invoices, from entering the invoices to processing them.

children.title: About Recurring Invoices
children.shortdesc:
You can set up recurring invoices for expenses that occur
        on a regular basis so that you do not have to manually enter invoices for each
            installment.7/27/18: Changed this to a concept topic
            and assigned it a guide_content outputclass so that it is accessed when clicking on the
            Recurring Invoices guide. Also added short description, broke out the task steps into a
            separate topic, and created links to all subtopics.

children.title: Set Up Recurring Invoices
children.shortdesc:
Use the AP Recurring Invoices form to set up recurring invoices for expenses that occur on a regular basis (rent, loans, or other fixed monthly charges).7/27/18: Cleaned up
         topic and removed incorrect information about Addenda Info tab from Step 8, related to EFTs
         (as there is no Addenda Info tab in AP Recurring Invoices). Also moved additional
         information about the Credit Service pay method to the F1 help, as it does not belong
         here.

children.title: Post Recurring Invoices
children.shortdesc: You can create and post invoices that you have set up as "recurring" invoices (in the AP Recurring Invoices form) so that you can pay them.

children.title: Processing Recurring Invoices
children.shortdesc:
Overview of the recurring invoice process, from entering
          invoices to posting them and reviewing payment history.

children.title: About the AP Recurring Invoices Form
children.shortdesc: Use the AP Recurring Invoices form to set up invoices for expenses that occur on a regular basis, such as monthly rent, loan payments, or other fixed monthly charges.

children.title: Field Definitions: AP Recurring Invoices Form
children.shortdesc: The following is a list of field descriptions for the AP Recurring Invoices  form. Many of the descriptions include links to other topics that provide additional information about or related to the topic.

children.title: About the AP Recurring Invoice Posting Form
Field Definitions: AP Recurring Invoice Posting Form
children.shortdesc: The following is a list of field descriptions for the AP Recurring Invoice Posting form. Many of the descriptions include links to other topics that provide additional information about or related to the topic.

children.title: Unapproved Invoices
children.shortdesc: Find information about the invoice approval workflow, from entering invoices to approving and processing them.

children.title: About Unapproved AP Invoices
children.shortdesc: An overview of the AP invoice approval workflow process.

children.title: Enter Unapproved Invoices
children.shortdesc: Use the AP Unapproved Invoice Entry form to enter invoice records that need to pass through an approval process before they are posted.

children.title: About Entering PO/SL Lines
children.shortdesc: When entering PO or SL lines for unapproved AP invoices, the system provides additional information about the specified purchase order/item or subcontract/item.

children.title: About Entering SM Work Order Lines
children.shortdesc: Once an invoice is posted using the AP Unapproved Invoice Posting form, lines of type 8-SM Work Order result in work completed miscellaneous lines in the SM Work Orders form (Work Completed tab).

children.title: Assign Reviewers to Unapproved Invoices
children.shortdesc: You can assign reviewers to unapproved invoices so that they can review and approve invoices before the invoices are posted.

children.title: About Setting Up Default Reviewers for Unapproved Invoices
About Defaulting Reviewer Groups to the Header of an Unapproved Invoice
children.shortdesc: There is not a recommended way to default reviewer groups to the invoice header in the AP Unapproved Invoice form.

children.title: About Defaulting Reviewers to the Header
children.shortdesc: During unapproved invoice entry, the purpose for adding reviewers to the header is to cause the same reviewers to subsequently appear on the Reviewers tab of each line.

children.title: About Defaulting Reviewer Groups to the Line
children.shortdesc: During unapproved invoice entry, the purpose for defaulting reviewer groups to the line is to cause the reviewers from the group to appear on the Reviewers tab for that specific line.

children.title: About Defaulting Reviewers to the Line
children.shortdesc: During unapproved invoice entry, the purpose for defaulting reviewers to the line is to save you the effort of doing it manually.

children.title: About Assigning Approval Sequences for Unapproved Invoices
children.shortdesc: You can assign approval sequences to unapproved invoices to control the order in which the invoice lines are exposed to reviewers who are assigned to the same invoice line.

children.title: About Changing Assigned Approval Sequences
children.shortdesc: You can change the approval sequence assignments for reviewers in the Reviewers tab of the unapproved invoice line (in the AP Unapproved Invoices form).

children.title: About Resolving Conflicting Approval Sequence Assignments
children.shortdesc: When individual reviewers are assigned by default onto unapproved invoice lines (in the AP Unapproved Invoice Entry form) for more than one reason, preference for the approval sequence, as well as the Optional Reviewer and Approve with missing data  fields, are given in a specific order.

children.title: Review Unapproved Invoices
children.shortdesc: Use the AP Unapproved Invoice Review form to view invoices assigned to you. Approving and rejecting are the most common tasks when reviewing unapproved invoices and invoice lines.

children.title: About Reviewing PO and SL Lines
children.shortdesc: During the invoice review process, when you review lines whose type is PO or SL, the system displays additional information in the Other Info tab.

children.title: Checking the Status of Unapproved Invoices
Edit Rejected Invoices
children.shortdesc: Use AP Unapproved Invoice Entry to view the approval status for invoice lines and to make edits.

children.title: Unapprove Approved Invoices
children.shortdesc: Use the AP Unapproved Invoice Review form to change an approved invoice to unapproved by selecting a check box.

children.title: Remove Invoices from a Batch
children.shortdesc: You can remove approved invoices from a posting batch that were brought into the batch in error, so that they are available to be posted later.

children.title: About Unapproved Invoices Features
children.shortdesc: Unapproved invoice functionality provides a workflow process for reviewing and approving invoices prior to processing.

children.title: About Reviewer Groups for Unapproved Invoices
children.shortdesc: You can use reviewer groups to assign multiple reviewers to unapproved invoices.

children.title: About Reviewers for Unapproved Invoices
children.shortdesc: Creating and assigning reviewers is the central required element in the unapproved invoice process.

children.title: About Reviewer Groups' Interaction with Individual Reviewers
children.shortdesc: AP unapproved invoice reviewers from groups act in tandem with reviewers assigned to the same invoice/line that are not part of the group.

children.title: About Optional Reviewers for Unapproved Invoices
children.shortdesc: When you use optional reviewers, only one of multiple individuals assigned to a single approval sequence are required to approve the line in order to keep the review process going.

children.title: About Thresholds for Unapproved Invoices
children.shortdesc: Thresholds provide a way to limit the number of invoices assigned to reviewers by setting a minimum invoice amount.

children.title: About Responsible Persons for AP Unapproved Invoices
children.shortdesc: The Responsible Person role belonging to each reviewer group acts as an overseer for the group and the invoices assigned to it by viewing the status on each invoice using the AP Unapproved Invoice Status form.

children.title: About the AP Unapproved Invoice Entry Form
children.shortdesc: Use the AP Unapproved Invoice entry form to enter unapproved invoices that you want held apart from other AP transactions for a specific reason, such as needing to review and approve them before posting and payment.

children.title: On Cost Invoices
children.shortdesc: Find information about setting up and processing on cost invoices. (Users in Australia only.)

children.title: About On-Cost Invoices
children.shortdesc: On-cost invoices are for paying burden amounts on behalf of those vendors (subcontractors) that are performing work for you or who are not directly employed by your organization.

children.title: Create On-Cost Types
children.shortdesc: You must set up on-cost types to represent vendors to which you will send on-cost payments.

children.title: Create On-Cost Groups
children.shortdesc: You can create on-cost groups that you can associate with subcontractors in the AP Vendor Master form.

children.title: Set up On-Cost Invoicing
children.shortdesc: An overview of the process to setting up on-cost invoicing.

children.title: Associating On-Cost Types with a Subcontractor (AU and CA)
children.shortdesc:
You must associate on-cost types with a subcontractor to allow paying burden/on-cost
      amounts on behalf of that subcontractor.

children.title: Add a Single Invoice to the On-Cost Workfile
children.shortdesc: You can manually add invoices to the on-cost workfile so that you can evaluate and edit them as needed.8/2/18: Broke this content out from the AP On-Cost Workfile topic into a separate topic, added a short description, and modified the context and step content slightly. Did not update Flare content at this time.--Deb

children.title: Add Multiple Invoices to the On-Cost Workfile
children.shortdesc: You can add multiple invoices to the on-cost workfile so that you can evaluate and edit them as needed.

children.title: Review Invoice Lines in the On-Cost Workfile

children.title: Taxes and Discounts
children.shortdesc: Find information about applying taxes and discounts to transactions in Accounts Payable.

children.title: Taxes
children.shortdesc: Find information about the different tax types, as well as posting and disbursing tax amounts in the Accounts Payable module.

children.title: Post Sales, Use, and Value Added Tax
children.shortdesc: You can apply taxes to transactions entered in Accounts Payable. However, there are setup requirements that must be met before you begin entering transactions.

children.title: About Tax Amount Disbursement
children.shortdesc: Vista disburses tax amounts differently based on tax type and upon any overrides you may have set up.

children.title: Discounts
children.shortdesc: Find information about the setup and processing steps for calculating discounts on Accounts Payable invoices.

children.title: About Discounts
children.shortdesc:
You can have discount amounts, discount dates, and due dates automatically
 computed for transactions entered in AP Transaction Entry, AP Unapproved
 Invoice Entry, and/or AP Recurring Invoice Entry.

children.title: How Discounts are Calculated
children.shortdesc: An outline of the setup and processing steps to calculate discounts on payable invoices. For more general information, see  About Discounts .

children.title: Vendors
children.shortdesc: Find information about setting up and maintaining vendor information, as well as vendor payment methods, setting vendors subject to 1099 (US), T5018 (CA), taxable payment reporting (AU), independent contractor reporting, tracking worker's compensation liabilities (CA), and compliance tracking.

children.title: Vendor Setup and Maintenance
children.shortdesc: Find information about setting up and maintaining vendor information, including sub- and temporary vendors, setting vendor payment information, associating on cost types with subcontractors (AU), and independent contractor reporting.

children.title: About Sharing the Vendor Master
children.shortdesc: If you have multiple AP companies that use the same vendors, you can set up your AP companies to share a single vendor master file.

children.title: Sub Vendors
children.shortdesc: You can link vendors together using the master vendor/sub vendor feature in Accounts Payable.

children.title: About Cross-Updates to PM Firms
children.shortdesc:
The changes you make for a vendor in the AP Vendor Master form can automatically update the corresponding record in
the          PM Firms form, and vice-versa.

children.title: Set the Vendor's Payment Method: U.S. and Canada
children.shortdesc: When setting up a vendor, you can select the payment method the system should use by default when you pay the vendor.

children.title: Set the Vendor's Payment Method: Australia
children.shortdesc: When setting up a vendor, you can select the payment method that the system should use by default when you pay the vendor.

children.title: About Additional Vendor Addresses
children.shortdesc: What to know when assigning additional addresses to vendors using the Addtl Addresses tab in the AP Vendor Master form.

children.title: About Temporary Vendors
children.shortdesc: Use the AP Vendor Master form to create records for vendors you don't intent to use for very long.

children.title: Set Vendors Subject to 1099 Reporting (United States)
children.shortdesc: You can set a vendor to be subject to 1099 Reporting in the AP Vendor Master form, even if you are not completely certain whether the vendor is subject to reporting.

children.title: Reporting Independent Contractors (United States)
children.shortdesc:
If your state requires businesses to report independent contractors, you can have the
      system automatically generate a report for all contractors meeting reporting requirements when
      posting payments in Accounts Payable.

children.title: Setting up Vendors for International Electronic Payments (United States)

      amounts on behalf of that subcontractor.

children.shortdesc: You can track subcontractors that do not have worker's compensation clearance certificates so that you can identify those for whom you need to pay worker's compensation liabilities.

children.title: Cash Receipts
children.shortdesc: You can use the Accounts Receiveable module to enter cash receipts (payments) for AR invoices.

children.title: Invoice Payments
children.shortdesc:
If you initialized payments (using AR Initialize Receipt),
		the system applies payments based on the information entered during initialization.

children.title: Payment Receipt Overrides
children.shortdesc:
You can apply more of a payment to
		Tax, Retainage, Finance Charges, or Discounts than is available or due for the invoice.

children.title: Retainage Payments
children.shortdesc: If you have posted retainage to AR invoices, you can have the system automatically apply payment to the unpaid portion of the retainage.

children.title: Payment Discounts
children.shortdesc: You can have discounts applied automatically or apply them manually.

children.title: Apply Payments to Customer Accounts
children.shortdesc: You can apply payments to a customer's account when you receive payment prior to invoicing the customer.

children.title: Assign "On Account" Payments to Invoices
children.shortdesc: You can assign payments that you applied to a customer's account to one or more invoices.

children.title: About Applying Payments to Taxes
children.shortdesc: Taxes applied to AR invoices are automatically paid when applying payments to the invoices.

children.title: Finance Charges
children.shortdesc:
If finance charges were applied to an invoice, and the
		payment is not fully applied after paying tax, it is then applied to the finance charges.

children.title: Exclude Finance/Service Charges When Applying Payments
children.shortdesc: If you have assessed finance/services charges to a customer, but don't want to apply any of their payment to the charges, you can exclude them when initializing payments.

children.title: About the AR Cash Receipts Form
children.shortdesc: Use the AR Cash Receipts form to enter cash receipts (payments) for AR invoices.

children.title: Cash Receipts Setup Options
children.shortdesc: There are several setup options available in AR Company Parameters that may have an effect on posting in AR Cash Receipts.

children.title: Detail Display Options for the AR Cash Receipts Form
children.shortdesc: There are several display options for AR Cash Receipts. These options determine the details that display on the form and the detail sort order.

children.title: Posting Shortcuts

children.title: Setup and Maintenance
children.shortdesc: Find information on setting up the Accounts Receivable module.

children.title: Invoice Numbering Scheme
children.shortdesc: The invoice numbering scheme you specify in the JB and MS Company Parameters forms may have an affect on the invoice numbering scheme used in AR.

children.title: About Payment Terms
children.shortdesc: Payment terms (set up in HQ Payment Terms) are used to determine due dates, discount dates, and discount rates for customers when posting transactions in AR.

children.title: Batch Processing
children.shortdesc: When processing data in any of the Accounts Receivable data entry programs, certain information is updated (interfaced) to other specified accounting modules by posting the batches in which the information is located.

children.title: Finance and Service Charges
children.shortdesc: Some states do not allow you to charge finance charges, but do allow you to charge service charges.

children.title: Exclude Invoices from Finance Charge Assessment
children.shortdesc:
If you want to exclude certain invoices from
                  finance/service charges, you have two options.

children.title: Discounts
children.shortdesc: The Accounts Receivable system allows you to use discounts when posting invoices and/or payments for customers.

children.title: About Payment and Tax Discounts
children.shortdesc: If you have opted to allow entering discounts on invoices (in the AR Company Parameters form), the system calculates payment discounts automatically for each invoice line entered.

children.title: About Posting Taxes
children.shortdesc: Within the AR Company Parameters file, there are two tax posting options that control whether taxes may be posted to AR transactions.

children.title: About Posting Taxes on Intercompany Invoices
children.shortdesc: If you post an intercompany invoice to which tax has been applied, the tax liability will remain with the Accounts Receivable company.

children.title: About the AR Company Parameters Form
children.shortdesc: You can use the AR Company Parameters form to set up the various control options for Accounts Receivable (AR) processing in a company. You must define these options before you begin processing in AR.

children.title: Invoices
children.shortdesc: You can use the Accounts Receivable module to use invoices to bill customers.

children.title: How Finance Charge Types Are Used
children.shortdesc: When using the AR Finance Charge form to automatically calculate finance/service charges, the system bases calculations on either the customer's account balance or individual invoices. Assign a Finance Charge Type to each customer to determine the calculation level.

children.title: Calculate Finance Charges
children.shortdesc: Use the AR Calculate Finance Charges form to specify a transaction dates for all system-generated finance charge invoices and enter criteria to determine how this form pulls invoices for finance charge assessment.

children.title: Assess Finance Charges to Multiple Customers
children.shortdesc: The system can calculate and assess finance charges to many customers at once.

children.title: Assess Finance Charges to a Single Customer
children.shortdesc: You can calculate and assess finance charges to a select customer.

children.title: Exclude Invoices from Finance Charges
children.shortdesc: You can use the AR Exclude From Finance Charge form to exclude invoices from finance charges.

children.title: Edit Finance Charges
children.shortdesc: You can edit system-calculated finance charges before posting the batch, or after posting as long as the GL period is still open.

children.title: How Finance/Service Charges are Credited to GL
children.shortdesc: When finance/service charges are calculated, the system credits the GL account specified for finance charge revenue in AR Receivable Types.

children.title: Automatic Distributions
children.shortdesc: If you are using the miscellaneous distributions feature, you can have distributions generated automatically for invoices and/or cash receipts. Automatic distributions are not available for miscellaneous cash receipts.

children.title: Transaction Entry
children.shortdesc: There are four transaction entry programs in Accounts Receivable, each designed to enter and maintain specific billing information.

children.title: AR Transaction Types
children.shortdesc: When posting transactions in the AR Invoice Entry program, you are required to enter a transaction type. The transaction type you select determines what type of information is required for input.

children.title: AR Transaction Types
children.shortdesc: Every transaction in Accounts Receivable must have a transaction type.

children.title: About Offset GL Accounts
children.shortdesc: The GL accounts assigned to AR invoices lines are used to offset the AR entry in the General Ledger.

children.title: Cash Receipts
children.shortdesc: Payment transactions are entered in the AR Cash Receipts program, and are used to post payments received from a customer.

children.title: Miscellaneous Cash Receipts
children.shortdesc: Miscellaneous Cash Receipts are used to post payments received from sources other than a customer, and are posted in AR Cash Receipts.

children.title: Miscellaneous Distributions
children.shortdesc: This option is available from either the AR Invoice Entry or the AR Cash Receipts programs, and is used to distribute amounts of an invoice or payment for which separate accounting and tracking may be required.

children.title: Adjustments, Credit Memos, and Write-Offs
children.shortdesc: Adjustments, Credit Memos, and Write-Offs are entered in the AR Invoice Entry form, but are posted somewhat differently in that they are applied to existing invoices and therefore, are not assigned invoice numbers.

children.title: Transaction Lines
children.shortdesc: Transaction lines are used to identify portions of an invoice or payment that are to be billed or paid separately.

children.title: AR Invoices
children.shortdesc: Invoices are used to bill customers for work completed on a job, or for materials used or supplied.

children.title: Setup Options (AR and JC)
children.shortdesc: Several of the fields on the AR Invoice Entry screen are affected in some way by the setup options selected in the AR Company Parameters, AR Customers, and the JC Contract Master programs. These fields are explained below.

children.title: About Invoices Interfaced from JB, MS, and SM
children.shortdesc: The Job Billing (JB), Material Sales (MS), and Service Management (SM) modules all provide the means to create their own invoices.

children.title: Interfaces From Job Billing and Material Sales
children.shortdesc: Both the Job Billing (JB) and Material Sales (MS) modules have their own invoicing capabilities.You can interface invoices generated in these modules to Accounts Receivable for tracking.

children.title: About Applying Taxes to Invoices
children.shortdesc: You can apply taxes in AR Invoice Entry if you selected the Post Taxes on Invoices check box in AR Company Parameters.

children.title: Retainage
children.shortdesc: Retainage is the portion of an invoice’s gross amount that the customer will not be required to pay until a later date, usually upon completion of the job.

children.title: Adding a Transaction to an AR Batch
children.shortdesc: You can use the AR Add Transaction to Batch form to add previously posted transactions to an open batch.

children.title: Statements
children.shortdesc: When setting up your customer accounts, the statement type you specify for each customer in AR Customers determines what type of account they will have, how the statements will be processed, and how payments are generally posted to the account.

children.shortdesc: Use the AR Automatic Write-Off form to write off account balances, invoice balances, and finance charges that are considered uncollectible.

children.title: Cash Management: Overview
children.shortdesc: The Cash Management system provides you with the capabilities to analyze bank accounts and reconcile account statements.

children.title: Set Up and Maintain Cash Management
children.shortdesc: Find information about setting up Cash Management and performing maintenance tasks.

children.title: Accounts
children.shortdesc: Cash Management accounts represent the bank accounts used by your company to conduct business. You can set up CM accounts for each type of bank account (such as checking and savings).

children.title: About Account Security
children.shortdesc: You can restrict access to bank accounts by turning on security for the CM Account datatype in VA Secure Tables and Datatypes, and by setting up restrictions in VA Data Security.

children.title: About Electronic Funds Transfer
children.shortdesc: Information required for electronic funds transfer (EFT) is stored in the CM Accounts program and applies to both Accounts Payable EFT’s and Payroll Direct Deposits.

children.title: Delete a CM Account
children.shortdesc: To delete a CM account that will no longer be used, you must purge all detail from all statements.

children.title: General Ledger: Overview
children.shortdesc: All of Viewpoint’s Accounting modules are fully integrated with the General Ledger.

children.title: General Ledger Setup and Maintenance
children.shortdesc: Find information about setting up and maintaining the General Ledger.

children.title: Set up a Fiscal Year
children.shortdesc: You will use the GL Fiscal Years form to set up fiscal years.

children.title: Delete a Fiscal Year With Beginning Balance and/or Budget Data
children.shortdesc:
Delete a fiscal year with beginning balance and/or budget
		data.

children.title: Delete a Fiscal Year without a Data Balance or Budget Data
children.shortdesc: You can delete a fiscal year as long as you have not begun posting transactions to any months within the fiscal year.

children.title: Deciding and Defining When To Go Live
children.shortdesc: It is recommended that you determine when you want to go live in the sub ledgers, and then set the last month closed to two months prior to the month that you plan to go live. It is also recommended that you set the last month closed in General Ledger to be the last month of the prior fiscal year-end.

children.title: About Fiscal Year for Management Reporter
children.shortdesc: When you are setting up a fiscal year in GL Fiscal Years, you will typically set your Management Reporter fiscal year equal to the Fiscal Year Ending month.

children.title: About Fiscal Periods
children.shortdesc: Many companies use Fiscal Years instead of Calendar Years as the basis for their accounting and financial reporting.

children.title: About Profit Centers
children.shortdesc: Profit centers are individual revenue-producing entities within a company.

children.title: Level Of Detail Interfaced To GL
children.shortdesc: Every account code set up in GL Chart of Accounts allows you to specify whether that account will have all transactions interfaced to it from subsidiary ledgers (other modules), or whether the system will use the information specified in the subsidiary modules company file to determine what level of detail will interface.

children.title: Prior Year Reporting
children.shortdesc: General Ledger retains monthly account balances for as many years as are desired.

children.title: About the GL Company Parameters Form
children.shortdesc: Use the GL Company Parameters form to set up standards for each GL company on your system, including setting up account codes, balancing journal entries, and establishing the number of months available for posting.

children.shortdesc: Within the General Ledger module you may set up as many journals as you desire to collect accounting information from other applications.

children.title: Journal References
children.shortdesc: GL references are used to group related transactions together within a journal.

children.title: Automatic Journal Entry
children.shortdesc: The Auto Journal Entry feature allows you to set up recurring journal entries to be run automatically each month.

children.title: Auto Reversing Journal Entries
children.shortdesc: The GL system includes a feature for processing automatic reversing journal entries.

children.title: Closing Ledgers
children.shortdesc: The act of closing a month indicates that it is complete and accurate and that no additions or corrections are needed.

children.title: Month

Enter a valid batch number. Press F4 to look up the available batches if
      needed.

children.title: General Ledger Accounts
children.shortdesc: Find information about General Ledger accounts.

children.title: Chart Of Accounts Design
children.shortdesc: Because the GL module allows up to 20 characters for the account code, you should be able to use your existing account code structure, if desired.

children.title: Use of Subaccounts in Account Structure
children.shortdesc: Embedding subaccounts into your chart of accounts structure has specific implications in financial statements creating using Management Reporter (component of Performance Point Server 2007).

children.title: Account Codes
children.shortdesc: Each General Ledger account is identified by a unique account code, making up what is commonly known as a Chart of Accounts.

children.title: About Subledger Codes
children.shortdesc: Subledger codes can prevent you from posting to an incorrect account when posting in the subsidiary ledgers (other modules).

children.title: About Interface Detail
children.shortdesc: If you check this field, interfaces to this account will include the greatest level of detail available.

children.title: Account Masking
children.shortdesc: When copying accounts from one source to another, you must specify both a source and destination 'account mask' using the format defined for your company.If you are not sure what format to use, contact your system administrator.

children.title: General Ledger Financial Reporting
children.shortdesc: Viewpoint offers you a number of ways to generate financial reports. Meeting a wide range of needs are options like standard reports within Vista, choice of a much more robust application called Financial Manager, or even third-party offerings.

children.title: Set Up a GL Income Statement Report
children.shortdesc: You can generate a report that represents GL accounts in a standard income statement using the GL Report Categories form.

children.title: Set Up a GL Balance Sheet Report
children.shortdesc: You can generate a report that represents asset and liability accounts in an order you set.

children.title: Setting Up a GL Statement of Cash Flow Report
children.shortdesc: You can generate a report that that represents GL accounts in a standard cash flow statement, displayed in an order you set, and consolidating income/expense accounts into Cash Flow from Operating Activities on the report. Use the GL Report Categories form to set up this report.

children.shortdesc: Use the GL Report Categories form to define a series of major and minor categories that you can assign to a GL Account Part 1 Instance.
